result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard Williams

records.addlTxt:
State is filing information now, mirrors the complaint.
Defense will continue.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:13 PM Defendant Leonard Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Leonard Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matter is set for a waived preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 3, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing set for 10/31/22 - no such number
Order to Transport. Proceeding in Br 1 in Portage on October 31, 2022 at 3:00 pm.

1:50 PM Defendant Leonard Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Leonard Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant can hear and see using the video
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Letter to the defendant in re:  signing/returning a signature bond

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

3:02 PM Defendant Leonard Williams not in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Pfeil states that the defendant is in Outagamie County Jail.
ADA Pfeil would not object to adjourning.
ADA Pfeil would request a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
Court sets a signature bond with conditions as stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
